definition: Dalton (name)/John Dalton (1766-1844), British scientist who contributed to atomic theory

road/path/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3]/principle/truth/morality/reason/skill/method/Dao (of Daoism)/to say/to speak/to talk/classifier for long thin things (rivers, cracks etc), barriers (walls, doors etc), questions (in an exam etc), commands, courses in a meal, steps in a process/(old) circuit (administrative division)
to stop/to pause/to arrange/to lay out/to kowtow/to stamp (one's foot)/at once/classifier for meals, beatings, scoldings etc: time, bout, spell, meal

sentences.english: So that's Dalton's law. I know Raoult's law.
sentences.chinese: 这就是道尔顿定律，我知道Raoult定律。
他们在决斗，杜林，道尔顿。

sentences.english: Dalton's law applies in the gas phase.
Dalton only deals with what's happening in the gas phase.
sentences.chinese: 道尔顿只处理气相中的问题。

sentences.english: And one of the earliest was that of John Dalton.
sentences.chinese: 最早期的解释之一来自约翰，道尔顿。

sentences.english: John Dalton also talked about other things.
sentences.chinese: 约翰，道尔顿，也谈论了其他的事情。

sentences.english: Dalton did a lot of work on vision.
sentences.chinese: 道尔顿做了很多关于视觉的工作。

definition: sievert (Sv), unit of radiation damage used in radiotherapy
rad (unit of absorbed dose of ionizing radiation) (loanword)
Rutherford (name)/Ernest Rutherford (1871-1937), early nuclear physicist from New Zealand
Hart or Herd (name)/Robert Hart (1835-1911), Englishman who served 1863-1911 in Qing dynasty customs office
Russell (name)/Bertrand Arthur William, 3rd Earl Russell (1872-1970), British logician, rationalist philosopher and pacifist
